posts.html:
May I subscribe, donate, or buy anything? What about cosmetic items?

No! Open RSC is forever to be a free game. Modern day server hosting costs are akin to pocket change and we have real jobs. We don't want to sell you anything. This is our hobby and we don't need any money. Just come have fun!


Who are the Open RSC admins?

Marwolf and Kenix


How does the Open RSC government run the game?

We believe in non-interference. If real life illegal activity is found happening, then we will ban the person.

Swearing, advertising, botting, scamming, hacking, and bullying may be given temporary or permanent mutes if bad behavior persists.


What is Open RSC's stance on botting?

We don't approve but know it is futile to play cat and mouse. We may create another game called something like BotScape Classic where only the best bot scripts can defeat the other bots.


Does Open RSC need any mods?

Not at the moment. We generally want to leave the in-game players alone.


How can I help?

Join the Discord chat and come talk to us! We have many issues created in the GitHub repos.


How do I run my own copy?

Visit the Open-RSC Docker-Home repository and follow the instructions. Open RSC is Windows, Mac, and Linux compatible!


From what period is Open RSC based on traditional RSC?

We believe the final version of traditional RSC is best to begin with but choose to disable some features added over time that we consider either annoying or pointless.

For those that want to run their own version of Open RSC, disabled features can be enabled in the config.


What are you guy's future plans for development?

We want to maintain a traditional RSC server but also build a fun server with all sorts of never before seen features that you too can run on your own instance!
posts.plaintext:
May I subscribe, donate, or buy anything? What about cosmetic items?

No! Open RSC is forever to be a free game. Modern day server hosting costs are
akin to pocket change and we have real jobs. We don't want to sell you anything.
This is our hobby and we don't need any money. Just come have fun!


Who are the Open RSC admins?

Marwolf and Kenix


How does the Open RSC government run the game?

We believe in non-interference. If real life illegal activity is found
happening, then we will ban the person.

Swearing, advertising, botting, scamming, hacking, and bullying may be given
temporary or permanent mutes if bad behavior persists.


What is Open RSC's stance on botting?

We don't approve but know it is futile to play cat and mouse. We may create
another game called something like BotScape Classic where only the best bot
scripts can defeat the other bots.


Does Open RSC need any mods?

Not at the moment. We generally want to leave the in-game players alone.


How can I help?

Join the Discord chat and come talk to us! We have many issues created in the
GitHub repos.


How do I run my own copy?

Visit the Open-RSC Docker-Home [https://github.com/Open-RSC/Docker-Home] 
repository and follow the instructions. Open RSC is Windows, Mac, and Linux
compatible!


From what period is Open RSC based on traditional RSC?

We believe the final version of traditional RSC is best to begin with but choose
to disable some features added over time that we consider either annoying or
pointless. 

For those that want to run their own version of Open RSC, disabled features can
be enabled in the config. 


What are you guy's future plans for development?

We want to maintain a traditional RSC server but also build a fun server with
all sorts of never before seen features that you too can run on your own
instance!

posts.title: Our Mission

posts.html:
Open RSC is a community-wide project using modern tools to build and run an antique game in light of RSC's August 2018 permanent closure.

Pioneered by a team of RSC veterans with security, openness, and non-profit in mind, Open RSC strives to build a Windows, Mac, and Linux compatible game that empowers both players and developers to pass on the torch and keep the abandoned RSC dream alive with fresh vigor.

Our replica RSC server will remain forever free to play, have minimal in-game governance (nothing illegal), and able to be hosted indefinitely thanks to modern day web hosting costs now being akin to pocket change. All of our code and projects are publicly available to contribute to and use. Customization is important and we want as many game features as possible able to be toggled on or off as desired as well as to provide a base for never before seen game servers, such as the idea of BotScape, where the player must write botting scripts to compete against other botting players or a survival game where player death is permanent.

We realize that to simply recreate the traditional game is not enough to drive continued interest. An RSC evolution is the next step - to design another game world using toggle-able features in the existing game code. One code source, two distinct games, and many combinations of feature choices. Think speed PKing with level caps raised to 150 or 300, dragon items, new spells, skills, a global wilderness with save zones, pet monsters to capture, spawn, and have follow you around, ghost cloaks for stealth, team teleport portals, player owned houses, and much more!

Our project makes use of virtualization, automation, and open source to simplify the building of the game, website, database, and development projects so that anyone can run on their own instance, either publicly with friends or in a single player mode without being foisted upon with difficult PC environment configurations or programming knowledge. We want this to be as simple as possible.

Thanks to the contributions of the RSC Preservation Project, Open RSC is able to be a lot closer to the original game.

Come join our Discord and find out how you can be a part of this!
posts.plaintext:
Open RSC is a community-wide project using modern tools to build and run an
antique game in light of RSC's August 2018 permanent closure.

Pioneered by a team of RSC veterans with security, openness, and non-profit in
mind, Open RSC strives to build a Windows, Mac, and Linux compatible game that
empowers both players and developers to pass on the torch and keep the abandoned
RSC dream alive with fresh vigor.

Our replica RSC server will remain forever free to play, have minimal in-game
governance (nothing illegal), and able to be hosted indefinitely thanks to
modern day web hosting costs now being akin to pocket change. All of our code
and projects are publicly available to contribute to and use. Customization is
important and we want as many game features as possible able to be toggled on or
off as desired as well as to provide a base for never before seen game servers,
such as the idea of BotScape, where the player must write botting scripts to
compete against other botting players or a survival game where player death is
permanent.

We realize that to simply recreate the traditional game is not enough to drive
continued interest. An RSC evolution is the next step - to design another game
world using toggle-able features in the existing game code. One code source, two
distinct games, and many combinations of feature choices. Think speed PKing with
level caps raised to 150 or 300, dragon items, new spells, skills, a global
wilderness with save zones, pet monsters to capture, spawn, and have follow you
around, ghost cloaks for stealth, team teleport portals, player owned houses,
and much more!

Our project makes use of virtualization, automation, and open source to simplify
the building of the game, website, database, and development projects so that
anyone can run on their own instance, either publicly with friends or in a
single player mode without being foisted upon with difficult PC environment
configurations or programming knowledge. We want this to be as simple as
possible.

Thanks to the contributions of the RSC Preservation Project, Open RSC is able to
be a lot closer to the original game.

Come join our Discord [https://discord.gg/94vVKND]  and find out how you can be
a part of this!

posts.title: Automated build testing with Travis Ci
posts.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"We now use Travis CI for automated build testing of the Docker-Home repository docker images as well as for the Game repository code compile testing for server and client for Oracle JDK and OpenJDK 8, 9, 10, and  11. Database SQL file imports are also tested for the Game repository. If something breaks in a commit or if a dependency stops functioning, this will help notify and track down as testing is done every 24 hours and after every repository commit."]]]]}
posts.html: We now use Travis CI for automated build testing of the Docker-Home repository docker images as well as for the Game repository code compile testing for server and client for Oracle JDK and OpenJDK 8, 9, 10, and ¬†11. Database SQL file imports are also tested for the Game repository. If something breaks in a commit or if a dependency stops functioning, this will help notify and track down as testing is done every 24 hours and after every repository commit.
posts.plaintext:
We now use Travis CI for automated build testing of the Docker-Home repository
docker images as well as for the Game repository code compile testing for server
and client for Oracle JDK and OpenJDK 8, 9, 10, and ¬†11. Database SQL file
imports are also tested for the Game repository. If something breaks in a commit
or if a dependency stops functioning, this will help notify and track down as
testing is done every 24 hours and after every repository commit.
posts.custom_excerpt: We now use Travis CI for automated build testing of the Docker-Home repository docker images as well as for the Game repository code compile testing for server and client for Oracle JDK and OpenJDK 8, 9, 10, and  11. Database SQL file imports are also tested for the Game repository.

Some people want nostalgia and to be able to  AFK grind for levels and a traditional world is best for them but there  are certain things that for me make the game slow and insufferable as a  regular player. Instead, we will simply allow the server operator to toggle  which features they want enabled in their config.xml file with a section  for non-traditional features."]]],[10,2],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"Have any other interesting ideas that could enhance the fun world that other servers have done / you always wanted to see?"]]]]}
posts.html:
The primary goal of Open RSC is to create a solid base that resembles the ¬†traditional game so that anyone can easily modify the game to fit ¬†whatever ideas they come up with.

For a second iteration of the game world, we plan on:

  • Players point to point teleportation (game minimap clicks and right click "teleport here")
  • Accessible bank window on-demand
  • a ¬†WoW-like combat experience rate that requires them to keep moving to ¬†higher level NPCs to keep getting experience as their combat level ¬†increases
  • New spells such as cast a teleport pool (for entire parties to escape) ¬†bands of attackers, an inhibit cast spell, an inhibit point to point ¬†teleportation spell * PvP-enabled multi cannons
  • Pet NPCs that follow their owner around, spawnable and capturable via item
  • World-wide wilderness for +-40? combat levels and various safe zones
  • Predefined player build selection screen for ranger, wizard, warrior, monk
  • Max skill levels set to 150 instead of 99
  • Dragon armour and weaponry
  • @ran@ party hats

Two game worlds can run with separate player databases, one being traditional and one being...more unique.

I have played longer as an admin in a private server than I have as an ¬†actual RSC and RS2 player. Some people want nostalgia and to be able to ¬†AFK grind for levels and a traditional world is best for them but there ¬†are certain things that for me make the game slow and insufferable as a ¬†regular player. I want to explore the difficulty of speed PKing and have ¬†a more casual experience be possible.

We are not going to have different code bases to have all of this be ¬†possible. Instead, we will simply allow the server operator to toggle ¬†which features they want enabled in their config.xml file with a section ¬†for non-traditional features.

Have any other interesting ideas that could enhance the fun world that other servers have done / you always wanted to see?
posts.plaintext:
The primary goal of Open RSC is to create a solid base that resembles the
¬†traditional game so that anyone can easily modify the game to fit ¬†whatever
ideas they come up with.



For a second iteration of the game world, we plan on:

 * Players point to point teleportation (game minimap clicks and right click
   "teleport here")
 * Accessible bank window on-demand
 * a ¬†WoW-like combat experience rate that requires them to keep moving to
   ¬†higher level NPCs to keep getting experience as their combat level
   ¬†increases
 * New spells such as cast a teleport pool (for entire parties to escape) ¬†bands
   of attackers, an inhibit cast spell, an inhibit point to point ¬†teleportation
   spell * PvP-enabled multi cannons
 * Pet NPCs that follow their owner around, spawnable and capturable via item
 * World-wide wilderness for +-40? combat levels and various safe zones
 * Predefined player build selection screen for ranger, wizard, warrior, monk
 * Max skill levels set to 150 instead of 99
 * Dragon armour and weaponry
 * @ran@ party hats



Two game worlds can run with separate player databases, one being traditional
and one being...more unique.



I have played longer as an admin in a private server than I have as an ¬†actual
RSC and RS2 player. Some people want nostalgia and to be able to ¬†AFK grind for
levels and a traditional world is best for them but there ¬†are certain things
that for me make the game slow and insufferable as a ¬†regular player. I want to
explore the difficulty of speed PKing and have ¬†a more casual experience be
possible.

We are not going to have different code bases to have all of this be ¬†possible.
Instead, we will simply allow the server operator to toggle ¬†which features they
want enabled in their config.xml file with a section ¬†for non-traditional
features.

Have any other interesting ideas that could enhance the fun world that other
servers have done / you always wanted to see?

If you are using OpenJDK on Linux, run this command first: "sudo apt install openjfx"

here.

If you are using OpenJDK on Linux, run this command first: "sudo apt install
openjfx"

posts.title: Major website update
posts.mobiledoc: {"version":"0.3.1","atoms":[],"cards":[],"markups":[],"sections":[[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"The Open RSC website has been significantly updated. By switching away from antiquated PHP and a PHPBB forum, we recognize that users prefer to communicate over Discord, Reddit, and Twitter."]]],[1,"p",[]],[1,"p",[[0,[],0,"This website serves as a jumping point for accessing everything and finding out the latest development news."]]]]}
posts.html:
The Open RSC website has been significantly updated. By switching away from antiquated PHP and a PHPBB forum, we recognize that users prefer to communicate over Discord, Reddit, and Twitter.

This website serves as a jumping point for accessing everything and finding out the latest development news.
posts.plaintext:
The Open RSC website has been significantly updated. By switching away from
antiquated PHP and a PHPBB forum, we recognize that users prefer to communicate
over Discord, Reddit, and Twitter.



This website serves as a jumping point for accessing everything and finding out
the latest development news.

settings.value: Striving for a replica RSC game and more
